instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Initially it was turning on but after a minute or so would keep going into hibernate/standby mode. Now however it is not even turning on but does have a green light on the charger. Testing the board voltages for S5 rails are present but not for S4.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is 0.195 volts
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 0 Volts

I am a bit unsure where to go from here.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: It should get a green light and then orange without battery connected. Is <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high? Where was the liquid damage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: Yeah I get a green light then it goes orange. Most of the water damage was around the connector for the keyboard backlight and the Mic connector. Everywhere else looking under a microscope doesn't seem too bad. I get 3.3 Volts at <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and in diode mode it measures 0.438.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: Could be anything. Inspect for corrosion around the usual suspects, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and traces/termination resistors, crap under SMC. PPVRTC present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: I have checked all these and there is no evidence of water damage or corrosion. PPVRTC is 3.3 volts. I am obviously missing something but I can't figure it out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damaged, S4 Rails Missing
threads.message: Check all rails for shorts? Is the keyboard backlight connector shorting out?
